me.utk.networking.oio

Class OldIO_Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.utk.networking.oio.OldIO_Client

  • public abstract class OldIO_Client
extends Object
    A utility class which provides a default implementation of ClientImplementation.

    This class provides a default implementation of ClientImplementation, which can be created and accessed via the defaultImplementation method provided by this class.

    The implementation-specific details of this default implementation can be found in the documentation of the defaultImplementation() method.

    Version:
    December 8, 2020
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam
    See Also:
    defaultImplementation(), ClientImplementation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ClientImplementation defaultImplementation()
      Creates a new ClientImplementation.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • defaultImplementation

        public static ClientImplementation defaultImplementation()
        Creates a new ClientImplementation.

        The default implementation of the ClientImplementation meets all of the guarantees and conditions required by the ClientImplementation definition.

        Of primary importance, creating a new default ServerImplementation launches two helper threads for connecting to and communicating with the server. These threads can only be stopped via the ClientImplementation.closeClient() method.

        Returns:
        The newly generated ClientImplementation
        See Also:
        ClientImplementation
